page.title: 14SOUTH SHIELDS-WHITE HORSE
page.content: TheWhite Horse-South Shields. The{White Horse} is a famous local landmark, visible for some distance.It is quite simply a large white horse painted on an exposed rock face overlooking Redwell Comprehensive School. There are many stories to explain the origin of the {White Horse} ,but the one accorded with most credibility concerns the Whitburn nobleman{Sir {Hedworth Williamson}. Every day Sir Hedworth and his wife would go riding on {Marsden Beach} for a picnic,but one day Sir Hedworth had to leave on business and{Lady {Williamson}had to go out on her {White {Horse}alone.She vanished that day.Search parties found no trace of {Lady Williamson}.The {White Horse}was scratched out as a tribute to {Sir {Hedworth}by his gamekeeper.
